title: National Roaming Services launched alongside Makran coastal highway
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 13 (APP): To mark the 77th Independence Day of Pakistan, the Ministry of IT and Telecom, PTA and USF launched National Roaming Services along Makran Coastal Highway to enhancing connectivity and public service in Balochistan.
According to news release issued here by the Ministry of IT on Tuesday, the milestone achievement launched during a ceremony held at PTA headquarters is a result of collaborative efforts among the Universal Service Fund (USF), Jazz, Ufone, under the patronage of PTA.
Shaza Fatima, Minister of State for IT & Telecom, Major General (R) Hafeez Ur Rahman Chairman PTA, Mr. Muhammad Naveed, Dr. Khawar Siddique Khokar, Members of The Authority, Mr. MudassarNaveed CEO USF, Aamir Ibrahim CEO Jazz, Ufone representatives and PTA team were present in the ceremony.
Availability of telecom services in such underserved areas is not only a technological upgrade but also a public service initiative by the government of Pakistan to improve livelihoods of people of Blaochistan, especially of the people living along Makran coastal highway.
